summary: Combine multiple dimensions into a single dimension
description:
Combines multiple given dimensions into a single dimension by flattening the values and merging the dimension labels with the given `label_separator`. Non-string dimension labels will be converted to strings.

Example: Executing the process with a data cube with two dimensions `A` (labels: `2020` and `2021`) and B (labels: `B1` and `B2`) and the data `[[1,2],[3,4]]` and the parameters `dimensions` = `[A,B]` and `target_dimension` = `X` will result in a data cube with one dimension `X` (labels: `2020~B1`, `2020~B2`, `2021~B1` and `2021~B2`) and the data `[1,2,3,4]`.

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.description:
The names of the dimension to combine. The order of the array defined the order in which the dimension labels and values are combined.

Fails with a `DimensionNotAvailable` exception if one of the specified dimension does not exist.

parameters.name: target_dimension
parameters.description: The name of an a target dimension with a single dimension label, which will be replaced. If a dimension with the given name doesn't exist yet, it is created with the specified name and the type `other` (see ``add_dimension()``).

parameters.name: label_separator
parameters.description: The string that will be used as a separator for the combined dimension labels. The string given must not be contained in any of the dimension labels.

returns.description: A data cube with the new shape. The number of dimensions decreases. The dimension properties (name, type, labels, reference system and resolution) for all other dimensions remain unchanged.

DimensionNotAvailable.message: A dimension with the specified name does not exist.
